results.name: Coefficients of unitary Hermite polynomials He_n(x).
comment: Also number of involutions on n labeled elements with k fixed points times (-1)^(number of 2-cycles).
He_n(x) := H_n(x/sqrt(2)) / sqrt(2)^n, with the coefficients of H_n(x) given in A060821. See the Maple program. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 13 2020

Index entries for sequences related to Hermite polynomials
formula: T(n, k) = (-2)^((k-n)/2)*n!/(k!*((n-k)/2)!) for n-k even, 0 otherwise.
E.g.f. of row polynomials {He_n(y)}:  A(x, y) = exp(x*y - x^2/2).
The umbral compositional inverses (cf. A001147) of the polynomials He(n,x) are given by the same polynomials unsigned, A099174. - _Tom Copeland_, Nov 15 2014

Exp(-D^2/2) x^n = He_n(x) = p_n(x+1) with D = d/dx and p_n(x), the row polynomials of A159834. These are an Appell sequence of polynomials with lowering and raising operators L = D and R = x - D. - _Tom Copeland_, Jun 26 2018
mathematica: H[0, x_] = 1; H[1, x_] := x; H[n_, x_] := H[n, x] = x*H[n-1, x] - (n-1)*H[n-2, x] // Expand; Table[CoefficientList[H[n, x], x], {n, 0, 11}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 11 2015 *)
program: for n in (1..11): A066325_row(n)  # _Peter Luschny_, Nov 01 2012
def H(n, x): return 1 if n==0 else x if n==1 else x*H(n - 1, x) - (n - 1)*H(n - 2, x)
def a(n): return Poly(H(n, x), x).all_coeffs()[::-1]
for n in range(21): print(a(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 26 2017
